data.title: Murray State University Athletics
data.meta_description: Marvin Williams (25) Forward - 2007-08: Appeared in 34 games, with seven starts ... A key player off the MSU bench, he averaged 18.2 minutes per game ... Ent...
data.text:
2007-08: Appeared in 34 games, with seven starts ... A key player off the MSU bench, he averaged 18.2 minutes per game ... Enters this season only three points shy of the 300 mark ... ... Had 16 games of five or more rebounds ... Was third on the team with 155 rebounds and a 5.0 average, his total was more than double the number of rebounds he hauled in as a freshman ... He was third on the team with 19 blocked shots ... Had five games with double-figure scoring ... Had a season-best 13 points against Jacksonville State (2-2-08) which was part of his first career double-double, he also had a career-best 11 rebounds in the game ... Had another double-figure rebound game when he came off the bench to grab 10 rebounds (1-19-08) against UT-Martin ... His .519 shooting percentage (68-of-131) was third best on the squad

2006-07: Played in 24 games as a true freshman and made eight starts ... Averaged 5.2 points per game and 2.8 rebounds ... Made .521 percent of his shots from the field (50-of-96) ... Scored a season-best 15 points against Tennessee-Martin (1-20-07) ... had a season-best eight rebounds against Rider (2-17-07) ... Had 12 blocked shots and 10 steals.

Before MSU: Joined the MSU program after an outstanding career at Lake Wales HS where he was name Florida Class 4A First Team ... His senior season was in 2004-05 when his team went 18-9 and lost in the state semifinals of the state tournament in which he scored 36 points ... He averaged 23 points per game and 8.7 rebounds as a senior and ranked among the nationâ€™s best in Hoop Scoop magazine as a top-50 player in Florida ... Played at Florida Prep School where he averaged 12 points per game ... Played at the same high school as NBA star Amare Stoudamire.
